thesis.description: The keyhole limpet, Fissurella barbadensis (Gmelin), is a diotocardian prosobranch gastropod belonging to the most primitive group, the Zeugobranchia. It is closely related to such genera as Diodora, Puncturella and Lucapinella. F. barbadensis ranges from S.E. Florida and Bermuda to the West Indies and from Mexico to British Guiana (Farfante 1943). [...]
thesis.creator: Ward, Jonet.
thesis.subject: Prosobranchia.
Zoology.
thesis.title: Some aspects of the biology of Fissurella Barbadensis (Gmelin).
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Langevin's classical theory of paramagnetism postulates magnetic substances as assemblies of isolated magnetic dipoles, which, in the absence of magnetic field are distributed in random directions, and show no magnetic moment. No consideration is given to the re-distribution of the isolated dipoles during the period immediately after an external magnetic field is applied. [...]
thesis.creator: Wang, Shu-Teh.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Spin-lattice relaxation time of colour centres in quartz.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Analyses have been made for the general case of chemical non-equilibrium effects in one-dimensional, two-dimensional and axisymmetric nozzle flows. The working fluid is assumed to be a mixture of n chemically reactive species. The method of characteristics has been applied to the solution of the nozzle flow problem in the two-dimensional and axisymmetric field. [...]
thesis.creator: Wang, Roa-Ling.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: Non-equilibrium supersonic nozzle flow of the the N2 + N2O4 = N2 + 2NO2 system.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: During the past 14 years, the structures of major hemicellulose in a great number of different wood species have been investigated. Useful generalization can now be made with respect to the amount, nature, and location of the hemicellulose in our more important trees. [...]
thesis.creator: Wang, Paul Yaocheung.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Uronic ester groups in wood and studies on the "lignin-carbohydrate" complex.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis will attempt three tasks. First of all, it will attempt to define the situation of Nigeria in the African subordinate state system. This will involve an analysis of the African subordinate state system as a policy environment, followed by an examination of the factors shaping Nigerian decision-making in the field of African policy, and, finally, an assessment of the political resources available to Nigeria for the purpose of implementing her policies in the system. [...]
thesis.creator: Wallace, Michael David.
thesis.subject: Economics.
thesis.title: Nigeria and African unity, 1958-1963.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

degree.discipline: Department of Economics and Political Science

thesis.description: Interest measurement has been accepted in the field of education by educators, psychologists, and guidance counsellors. It is also being introduced in the occupational fields. Among the various interest tests that were published, the Strong Vooational Interest Blank and the Kuder Preference Record are most commonly used. [...]
thesis.creator: Viswanathan, Kamakshi.
thesis.subject: Teachers -- Selection and appointment.
Education.
thesis.title: Interest measurement with particular reference to the Kuder preference record and its use in the selection of student teachers.

thesis.description: La paix de Callias, paix entre Athênes et la Perse, aurait été conclue au milieu du Ve siècle par un nommé Callias. Théopompe et Callisthène, au IV, auraient affirmé qu'elle n'a pas eu lieu. Et puis la tradition de la paix, après cet orage, a réussi à traverser les siècles. [...]
thesis.creator: Violette, Jean Guy.
thesis.subject: Peace of Callias.
Classics.
thesis.title: La paix de Callias : un problème historique et littéraire.

thesis.description: Hyperactivity is a common presenting symptom among children seen in psychiatric clinics, and refers to an excessive level of activity which is sufficiently sustained to become a serious source of complaint. Until recently interest in the hyperactive child was confined to the psychiatric literature. As a result, most of the information currently available deals with questions of diagnosis and treatment. [...]
thesis.creator: Freibergs, Vaira.
thesis.subject: Psychology.
thesis.title: Concept learning in hyperactive and normal children.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: At the beginning of the International Geophysical Year few people were fully aware of the difficulties of conducting an Antarctic ice accumulation program. In fact, the only man of the present generation having made an extensive study of Antarctic firn (metamorphosed snow) was Valter Schytt of the Norwegian-British-Swedish Expedition, 1949-52. Quite probably he was the one man who realized just how bewildering interpretation of stratigraphy of a snow pit wall in Antarctica could be. [...]
thesis.creator: Vickers, William Ward.
thesis.subject: Geography.
Snow -- Antarctica
Ice -- Antarctica.
thesis.title: A study of ice accumulation in western Antarctica.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Canada's economic growth is becoming increasingly dependent on the supply of skilled manpower that is able to cope with the complexities of a modern technological society. It is apparent that unless the youth of Canada are prepared, through education and training, to assume productive roles in the country's work force then all other public policy to stimulate economic growth will be to little avail. [...]
thesis.creator: Verrier, William L.
thesis.subject: Technical education -- Canada.
Education.
Education -- Canada -- Finance.
thesis.title: Investment in technical and vocational education in Canada.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The struggle between France and Germany for control of the Saar territory after World War I was by no means a new feature in Saar history. On the contrary, it was merely the perpetuation of a long history of conflict in this region. One reason for the importance of the Saar, which comprises the territory extending along the banks of the Saar river which flows north to the Moselle, is its significance as a route between the Rhine and the territory to its west. [...]
thesis.creator: Vallely, Lois M.
thesis.subject: Stephens, George Washington, 1866-
History.
Saar River Valley (France and Germany) -- Politics and government.
World War, 1914-1918 -- Territorial questions -- Saar River Valley (France and Germany).
thesis.title: George Stephens and the Saar Basin Governing Commission.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This study concerns the two Eskimo communities of Coppermine (67° 49'N, 115°05'W) and Holman (70°44'N, 117° 45'W), and their hinterlands. Coppermine is situated on the Arctic Coast of the Mackenzie District of the Northwest Territories; almost 1000 miles north of Edmonton, Alberta. [...]
thesis.creator: Usher, Peter J.
thesis.subject: Northwest Territories -- Economic conditions.
Natural resources -- Northwest Territories.
Inuit -- Northwest Territories.
Geography.
thesis.title: Economic basis and resource use of the Coppermine-Holman region, N.W.T.

thesis.description: The largest known magnetite deposits in Australia are present in three areas of the Savage River - Rocky River region in northwestern Tasmania. Magnetite is associated with amphibolite or disseminated in meta-sediment. Folded, steeply-dipping Precambrian Whyte Schist underlies most of the region and encloses bodies and concordant linear sheets of amphibolite, which may be genetically related to a Cambrian serpentinized basic and ultrabasic complex. [...]
thesis.creator: Urquhart, G.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Magnetite deposits of the Savage river - Rocky River Region, Tasmania.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Ventricular fibrillation is the usual fatal episode in the natural history of coronary artery disease. First described by Ludwig and Hoffa in 1849 (1), it continues to confuse the medical intellect, killing when anatomic disease is mild and stopping a good heart as readily as a damaged heart. [...]
thesis.creator: Turnbull, Alan D.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: Studies on the ventricular fibrillation threshold in dogs.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Generally, a few days after an animal, or man, is exposed to natural infection or is subjected to active immunization, antibodies possessing the property of combining specifically with the homologous antigen, i.e. antigen responsible for the sensitization, appear in circulation (1). [...]
thesis.creator: Turcotte, Raymond.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Characterization of haemagglutinating antibodies to tuberculoprotein in humans.

thesis.description: Studies of the phenomenon of language acquisition conducted prior to 1950 were mainly theoretical in nature and dealt alomost exclusively with the acquisition of the primary or native language in the young child (40). Subsequent to 1950, an increasing amount of experimental research has been devoted to language acquisition. [...]

thesis.title: The contribution of motivation to achievement in a second language.

thesis.description: The mathematical technique of dynamic programming may be used to determine the control function which will optimize the performance of a system with respect to some given performance criterion. To illustrate this, the optimal control function for a second order system was calculated, subject to constraints on the state variable es as well as the control function. [...]
thesis.creator: Tunner, Alex.
thesis.subject: Electrical Engineering.
thesis.title: On the practical application of dynamic programming to the optimal design of linear control systems.

thesis.description: A detailed investigation of the nature of the pluralization rules of preschool children is reported in this thesis. This research tries to determine the extent of the child's acquisition of the standard rules of adult speakers of English and to uncover the existence of any rules peculiar to children. [...]

Psychology.

thesis.description: Adrenals from adult male mice, when incubated in Krebs-Ringer bicarbonate glucose solution, produce corticosterone, aldosterone, and a polar lipid with the properties of 18-hydroxycorticosterone; the polar fraction also contains other reducing lipids. [...]

thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Steroid production by incubated mouse adrenals.

thesis.description: The term "community pastures" refers to a situation in which areas of land are specifically developed and managed in an organized and systematic manner for the purpose of collective grazing of livestock on a rental-fee basis. Being fundamentally an investment enterprise requiring the allocation of scarce resources, such projects could be undertaken by any economic organization, private or public, once the expected future rate of return is greater than the current cost of capital. [...]
thesis.creator: Toolsie, Diaram.
thesis.subject: Economics.
thesis.title: The economic feasibility of community pastures in the livestock economy of Quebec.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Settlement is a very important engineering problem which usually occurs when a buried soft clay stratum is loaded by a building or any kind of structure. In the laboratory, the method of estimating the amount and the rate of the settlement has long been developed; this test is called the consolidation test. [...]

thesis.description: There is a region of the upper atmosphere called the mesopause which currently excites much interest. This region lies approximately between the altitudes of 80 and 90 kilometers. Today, knowledge of conditions in this region is necessary to predict satellite orbit decay, but academic interest lies in the attempt to set up a consistent model atmosphere (e.g. Bates and Nicolet (1)). [...]

thesis.title: Rate measurement of the oxygen atom-hydrogen atom reaction.

thesis.description: Dans un roman où le Narrateur apparaît tour à tour comme héros, spectateur et commentateur désintéressé - où on peut selon les chapitres assister à l'éclosion d'une vocation, suivre l'évolution d'une société ou s'abandonner aux méandres de longues méditations philosophiques ou poétiques - nul n'est surpxis de se trouver à maint tournant face à face avec l'éternel protagoniste de toute destinée : la Mort. [...]

thesis.subject: French.
thesis.title: Le theme de la mort dans A la recherche du temps perdu de Marcel Proust.

thesis.description: Strontium originating from nuclear detonations has now been disseminated throughout the globe and measurable quantities of this radionuclide are present in practically all surface soil, food and human bone. The biological chain of radiostrontium has been extensively investigated in the last two decades. These have shown that strontium is similar but not identical with calcium in its metabolic behaviour in mammals. [...]
thesis.creator: Thyvalikakath, Paul M.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: Studies on the intestinal absorption of radioactive strontium.

thesis.description: On reading the biblical version of the Creation and Fall of Adam and Eve (Genesis ii-iii) we find that the presentation lends itself to two possible interpretations: on the one hand, we may regard the narrative as being a mere history of two lives; or, what is more likely, we may see in the report an attempt to explain the present state of the World through an allegorical account of the entrance of evil into the mind of Man and so into the Macrocosm. [...]
thesis.creator: Thorpe, Marjorie R.
thesis.subject: Eve (Biblical figure).
Milton, John, 1608-1674. Paradise lost.
English.
thesis.title: The person of Eve in Paradise Lost.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
